intro: Semecarpus cuneifolius, commonly known as the Indian horse chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spiny fruits containing one or two seeds. Its bark is thick and fissured, often exuding a sticky resin, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant has traditional medicinal uses in Ayurvedic medicine.
